metadata.title: CVE-2017-17833 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
OpenSLP releases in the 1.0.2 and 1.1.0 code streams have a heap-relatedmemory corruption issue which may manifest itself as a denial-of-service ora remote code-execution vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17833` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libslp1 - 1.2.1-9ubuntu0.3
slpd - 1.2.1-9ubuntu0.3
slptool - 1.2.1-9ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openslp-dfsg package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.1-9ubuntu0.3').
